title: Brownie Test Interactive Mode
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie` Version: 1.15.2
* `ganache-cli` Version: 6.12.2
* `solc` Version: 0.8.6
* Python Version: 3.7.10
* OS: linux

### What was wrong?

Please include information like:

* `brownie test tests/xx.py --interactive`
* I am unable to enter into the interactive mode. Somehow `brownie run xx -I` works fine but `brownie test xx -I` doesn't. 

```bash
‚ùØ brownie test -I
Brownie v1.15.1 - Python development framework for Ethereum

============================================================================= test session starts ==============================================================================
platform linux -- Python 3.7.10, pytest-6.2.4, py-1.10.0, pluggy-0.13.1
plugins: eth-brownie-1.15.1, hypothesis-6.14.3, forked-1.3.0, web3-5.21.0, xdist-1.34.0
collected 38 items

Launching 'ganache-cli --port 8545 --gasLimit 12000000 --accounts 10 --hardfork istanbul --mnemonic brownie'...

tests/test_approve.py .....F......                                                                                                                                       [ 31%]
tests/test_transfer.py .........                                                                                                                                         [ 55%]
tests/test_transferFrom.py .................                                                                                                                             [100%]

=================================================================================== FAILURES ===================================================================================
_________________________________________________________________________________ test_approve _________________________________________________________________________________
token = <Token Contract '0x3194cBDC3dbcd3E11a07892e7bA5c3394048Cc87'>, accounts = <brownie.network.account.Accounts object at 0x7f002d53a6d0>

    def test_approve(token, accounts):
>       print(non_exist)
E       NameError: name 'non_exist' is not defined

tests/test_approve.py:12: NameError
=========================================================================== short test summary info ============================================================================
FAILED tests/test_approve.py::test_approve - NameError: name 'non_exist' is not defined
========================================================================= 1 failed, 37 passed in 7.97s =========================================================================
Terminating local RPC client...
```
Problem is solved after I delete `root/.brownie` and reinstall `eth-brownie` üòÑ
